definition: right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: But light struggled with dark in Nixon's soul.
sentences.chinese: 然而，光明與黑暗的對決卻蟄伏於他的內心深處。

sentences.english: Hot Rod and Galvatron fight deep within Unicron.
sentences.chinese: 熱破與驚破天於宇宙大帝體內對決。

sentences.english: For the first time in ages, Jedi and Sith dueled.
sentences.chinese: 這是許多年以來，絕地和西斯的第一次對決。

sentences.english: That’s why they’re the subject of this week’s Web Faceoff.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼他們成爲了本週網絡對決的主題。

sentences.english: But there seemed to be more than policy involved in the two men’s courtroom confrontation.
sentences.chinese: 不過這兩個人的法庭對決看來涉及的遠不止政策本身。

sentences.english: Our hilarious Ant-Man had a funny fight with Falcon.
sentences.chinese: 獵鷹和我們新任的逗逼蟻人在這裏有了場搞笑的對決。

sentences.english: This is a fight against fascism.
sentences.chinese: 一場與法西斯的殊死對決。

sentences.english: Ventress proved her skills by challenging Dooku to a duel.
sentences.chinese: 文崔斯也在挑戰杜庫的對決中證明了她的技能。

sentences.english: He also lost four in a row to Andy Murray.
sentences.chinese: 與穆雷的對決，也是四陣連敗，無一勝蹟。

sentences.english: For the first time in ages, Jedi and Sith dueled .
sentences.chinese: 終於，絕地和西斯之間命運的對決又要再一次展開了。

sentences.english: I don’t want to risk losing a contest in violence.
sentences.chinese: 我可不想在一場暴力對決中輸得一敗塗地。

sentences.english: The occasion may represent one of the greatest selling matchups of all time.
sentences.chinese: 這場對決可謂營銷行業裏的經典場面之一。

sentences.english: Is it east verse west, or man against man?
sentences.chinese: 是東西方對決抑是人與人的爭鬥？

sentences.english: The theme of many stories is that of good versus evil.
sentences.chinese: 很多故事的主題都是善與惡的對決。

sentences.english: Oslash; Hot Rod and Galvatron fight deep within Unicron.
sentences.chinese: 熱破與驚破天於宇宙大帝體內對決。

definition: to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
decisive battle/to fight a decisive battle/to fight for supremacy in ...
(of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
